import React, {useState} from "react" import { AppContext } from "../appProvider" import axios from "axios" function Hiking() { const contextItems = React.useContext(AppContext) const [selects, setSelects] = React.useState([]) const [eachState, setEachState] = React.useState([]) // MAY NEED TO PASS IN KEY FOR EACH MAPPED DIV ON LINE 11 function clearState(){ setEachState([]) } //THIS MAPS THROUGH EVERY RECALL ITEM IN THE CONTEXT ARRAY function showList() { clearState() const list = contextItems.recalls.map(thing => { if(thing.state === selects) { setEachState(prevState => [...prevState, thing] ) } } ) console.log(eachState) } // LINES 34 -45 ARE BUTTON LOGIC TO DISPLAY SPECIFIC STATES const wa = contextItems.recalls.filter((item) => { if (item.state === "WA") return ( true ) }) const stateList = eachState.map(thing =>

Location:

{thing.city}, {thing.state}. {thing.country}

Product Type:

{thing.product_type}

Product Description:

{thing.product_description}

Reason for Recall:

{thing.reason_for_recall}
) return ( <>

Hiking Page Title

Content about hiking and why it's great

<>

Use our free search tool to see day hikes in your state.

Select your state from the drop-down menu below.





{stateList}
) } export default Hiking
